elements.title: William Thomas Pike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Thomas Pike, a convicted felon, published a biographical series (volume pictured), which includes traders, bishops, and a lord mayor of London, but almost no women?

elements.title: Pagtatag! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that SB19's second extended play (EP), Pagtatag!, is part of a trilogy about their artistry?

elements.title: Carmen Valero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1976, Carmen Valero became the first female track and field athlete to represent Spain at the Olympics?

elements.title: yobidashi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that yobidashi often receive their trousers from sumo wrestlers who have been promoted to the rank of yokozuna or ōzeki?

elements.title: Fionna Campbell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fionna Campbell was created as gender-swapped Adventure Time fan art, but ended up getting her own show?

elements.title: southern molly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for the southern molly, sexual selection favors smaller males because they copulate by sneaking up to females?

elements.title: Patrick O'Connell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Patrick O'Connell made his NFL debut on his birthday, in the only game he played that year?

elements.title: he would, wouldn't he (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "he would, wouldn't he"?
